title: Man arrested in Somerville fire that destroyed home under construction
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: John Grasso, 35, was arrested for a Somerville fire that destroyed a house and damaged nearby buildings.
Grasso, who is unhoused, faces charges of wanton destruction of property and nighttime breaking and entering.
The August 20 fire at 75 Thurston St. displaced residents and remains under investigation by local authorities.

title: Bill Belichick reportedly bans Patriots scouts from UNC practices
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick bans New England Patriots scouts from observing University of North Carolina practices.
Patriots personnel can request film and contact UNC staff for player information despite ban.
Belichick's departure from Patriots was contentious, with conflicting narratives about his exit.

title: Mass. schools placed in lockdown due to hunter with unloaded gun, police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Two Upton schools were locked down after reports of a man with a gun turned out to involve a hunter.
The hunter, wearing camouflage, was carrying an unloaded firearm back to his car after legally hunting.
Upton Police thanked the community for cooperation and the individual for coming forward to clarify the situation.

title: Missing daughter of Worcester mother in ICE detention found, police say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: The 13-year-old daughter of Rosane Ferreira De Oliveira, found safe in Massachusetts, is now back in DCF custody.
The 13-year-old was originally reported missing with her 17-year-old sister after their mother's ICE arrest in Worcester.
Nayara Ferreira De Moura, the 17-year-old sister, remains missing since July, reportedly last seen in Lancaster.

title: Here’s what to know about the HHS demand that Mass. erase ‘gender ideology’ from sex ed materials
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: The Trump administration demands Massachusetts remove references to gender identity from federally funded sex ed materials.
Massachusetts risks losing $2.36 million in PREP funding if changes aren't made by October 27.
The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services targets inclusivity in sex education as part of broader federal actions.

title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão named first head coach of Boston Legacy FC, joining from Portuguese club Benfica.
Patão led Benfica to five Campeonato Nacional Feminino titles and a UEFA Champions League quarterfinal appearance.
Patão aims to build a competitive team in the NWSL, embracing new challenges and local culture in Boston.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman enters the 2025-26 season without contract issues, ready for Boston Bruins training camp.
Swayman struggled in 2024-25 with a .892 save percentage, his worst in the NHL, due to the contract dispute.
A strong performance at the World Championships and off-season changes have boosted Swayman's confidence for the new season.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels is preparing to face his former team, the Raiders, in the Patriots' Sunday home opener.
McDaniels reflected on learning from his 9-16 head coaching record with the Raiders, emphasizing growth from failure.
McDaniels praised new Raiders coach Pete Carroll, calling him one of the best coaches in football history.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks, a Pittsfield native, is cast as Karen Read in a Prime Video limited series about the murder case.
The series is based on the "Karen" podcast and separate from Karen Read's own adaptation deal with LBI Productions.
Poll shows 48% of readers support Banks' casting; alternatives suggested include Anne Hathaway and Amanda Peet.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun in Uncasville, Connecticut, ranked No. 2 and Foxwoods Resort Casino in Mashantucket ranked No. 3 in USA Today's list.
The rankings are part of USA Today's 2025 10Best Readers’ Choice Awards for casinos outside Las Vegas.
Mohegan Sun was named the top casino for slots, featuring two casinos with diverse gaming options and table games.
